intro: Gonolobus hammelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that open in the morning. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Gonolobus hammelii is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by Native Hawaiians for various health purposes.
